pair.chq: Patient in the hospital with premature rupture of membranes and twins. I read the RADIUS (Routine Antenatal Diagnostic Imaging With Ultrasound) trial in the New England Journal of Medicine. I never used to do routine ultrasound but here everybody does it. I felt vindicated when RADIUS (Routine Antenatal Diagnostic Imaging With Ultrasound) was published. But I recently went to an OB talk and they were bad mouthing the study. This patient wanted to know the sex so I ordered the ultrasound and she turned out to have twins. So now I'm uncertain about whether I should be doing routine prenatal ultrasound.
